meanings.definition: To surpass in time or duration.
meanings.sent1: The old clock had outgone all the others in the house.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner outgone his personal best time.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outgone the hare in the race, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him had outgone the boundaries of time and space.
meanings.sent5: The sun had outgone the moon in its journey across the sky.

meanings.definition: To exceed in accomplishment or achievement.
meanings.sent1: She had outgone her classmates in the science fair project.
meanings.sent2: The artist outgone all expectations with her latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The little ant outgone the other ants by finding the biggest crumb.
meanings.sent4: His generosity had outgone any other act of kindness she had witnessed.
meanings.sent5: The student had outgone the teacher in understanding the complex topic.
